questiontext.text:
A meteorological station recorded the rainfall pattern for a specific region over a period of 12 months. The data was grouped into unequal time intervals based on seasonal shifts.

The histogram below represents this data. The \(x\)-axis represents Time in Months (0 = Start of Jan, 12 = End of Dec), and the \(y\)-axis represents the Frequency Density (Rainfall Intensity in mm/month).

[[jsxgraph width="750px" height="450px"]] JXG.Options.text.useMathJax = true; // 1. IMPORT DATA var x = [0, {#x1#}, {#x2#}, {#x3#}, {#x4#}, {#x5#}]; var h = [{#h1#}, {#h2#}, {#h3#}, {#h4#}, {#h5#}]; // Determine bounds var max_h = Math.max(...h); var max_x = 12; // 2. INIT BOARD // Grid:true gives the background lines. // boundingBox padded to make axes clear. var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox: [-1, max_h + 2, max_x + 1, -1], grid: true, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false, zoom: {enabled: false}, pan: {enabled: false} }); // 3. AXES // Ticks set to distance 1 to match the integer heights var yAxis = board.create("axis", [[0, 0], [0, max_h + 2]], { name: "\\(Density\\)", withLabel: true, label: { offset: [-25, 0] }, ticks: { distance: 1, minorTicks: 0 } }); var xAxis = board.create("axis", [[0, 0], [max_x + 1, 0]], { name: "\\(Months\\)", withLabel: true, label: { offset: [-10, -20] }, ticks: { distance: 1 } }); // 4. DRAW BARS (Histogram) for(let i=0; i<5; i++){ board.create('polygon', [ [x[i], 0], [x[i+1], 0], [x[i+1], h[i]], [x[i], h[i]] ], { fixed: true, // Prevent dragging fillColor: '#2E8B57', // SeaGreen fillOpacity: 0.5, borders: { strokeColor: 'black', strokeWidth: 2, fixed: true }, vertices: { visible: false, // No corner dots fixed: true } }); } // No Frequency Polygon drawn. [[/jsxgraph]]

(a) The "Monsoon" period occurs in the interval \({@x2@} < t \leq {@x3@}\). Using the frequency density shown on the graph, calculate the total rainfall (in mm) that fell during this specific month.

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

(b) Estimate the cumulative rainfall (total amount of rain) recorded from the start of the year up to the middle of the 8th month (i.e., \(t = 7.5\)).

[[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]]

(c) Calculate what percentage of the total annual rainfall occurred during the "Monsoon" interval (\({@x2@} < t \leq {@x3@}\)). (Give your answer as a percentage rounded to 2 decimal places).

[[input:ans3]]% [[validation:ans3]]

(d) Calculate the mean monthly rainfall for the entire year.

[[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]]

[[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

Understanding the Graph

In this histogram, the Area of each bar represents the total quantity of rainfall (Frequency) for that period.

\( \text{Total Rainfall (Area)} = \text{Width (Months)} \times \text{Frequency Density (Height)} \)

(a) Monsoon Rainfall (Interval \({@x2@} < t \leq {@x3@}\))

  • Width: The interval is from {@x2@} to {@x3@}, so width = \({@w3@}\) month.
  • Height: Reading from the graph, the Frequency Density is {@h3@} mm/mo.
  • Calculation: \( \text{Rainfall} = {@w3@} \times {@h3@} = \mathbf{@freq3@} \text{ mm} \).

(b) Estimation up to \(t = 7.5\)

We need the area of the graph from \(t=0\) to \(t=7.5\).

  1. Complete Intervals:
    Months 0–{@x1@}: \( {@w1@} \times {@h1@} = {@freq1@} \)
    Months {@x1@}–{@x2@}: \( {@w2@} \times {@h2@} = {@freq2@} \)
    Months {@x2@}–{@x3@}: \( {@w3@} \times {@h3@} = {@freq3@} \)
    Subtotal = {@rain_prev@} mm
  2. Partial Interval:
    The cut-off \(t=7.5\) is inside the interval \({@x3@} < t \leq {@x4@}\).
    Width of partial section = \(7.5 - {@x3@} = {@p_width@}\).
    Height of this bar = {@h4@}.
    Partial Rain = \({@p_width@} \times {@h4@} = {@rain_partial@}\) mm.

Total Estimate: \({@rain_prev@} + {@rain_partial@} = \mathbf{@ta2@} \text{ mm}\).

(c) Percentage Calculation

First, calculate the Total Annual Rainfall by summing the area of all 5 bars:

\( \text{Total} = {@freq1@} + {@freq2@} + {@freq3@} + {@freq4@} + {@freq5@} = {@total_rain@} \text{ mm} \)

The percentage contribution of the Monsoon interval is:

\( \frac{@freq3@}{@total_rain@} \times 100 = \mathbf{@ta3_disp@}\% \)

(d) Mean Monthly Rainfall

The mean monthly rainfall is the Total Rainfall divided by the total number of months (12).

\( \text{Mean} = \frac{@total_rain@}{12} = \mathbf{@ta4_disp@} \text{ mm/month} \)

questiondescription.text:
Daniel Murunga

Given a histogram representing annual rainfall grouped into unequal seasonal intervals, the student must calculate specific interval totals (using Area = Width \(\times\) Density), estimate cumulative rainfall up to a non-integer time point (linear interpolation within a bin), calculate the percentage contribution of a specific season, and determine the mean monthly rainfall.

truefeedback.text: Correct. You correctly calculated the area (Width \(\times\) Height) for the monsoon month.

falsefeedback.text: Incorrect. Remember that Total Rainfall is the Area of the bar. Multiply the width of the interval (1 month) by the density shown on the y-axis.

truefeedback.text: Correct. You accurately estimated the cumulative rainfall by summing the full intervals and the partial section.

falsefeedback.text: Incorrect. Calculate the area of all bars to the left of \(t=6\), then add the area of the partial rectangle from \(t=6\) to \(t=7.5\).
Incorrect. Calculate (Monsoon Rain / Total Annual Rain) \(\times\) 100.
Incorrect. Divide the Total Annual Rainfall by 12 months.
